chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
Y: Type
X: Type
c: (nat -> nat) -> nat -> X -> list Y
lc: X -> nat
Hc: forall (f : nat -> nat) (n : nat) (x : X), length (c f n x) = lc x
i: nat
mm: list X
ll: list X
j: nat

Goal:
link i (ll ++ mm) j = link i ll j ++ link (length ll + i) mm (lsum ll + j)

Premises:

VarMap.Branch : VarMap.t ?A -> ?A -> VarMap.t ?A -> VarMap.t ?A where ?A : [X : Type Y : Type c : (nat -> nat) -> nat -> X -> list Y lc : X -> nat Hc : forall (f : nat -> nat) (n : nat) (x : X), length (c f n x) = lc x i : nat ll : list X mm : list X j : nat |- Type]
length_compiler_app : forall ll mm : list X, lsum (ll ++ mm) = lsum ll + lsum mm
subcode_app_inv : forall (X : Type) (Q : code X) (i j : nat) (a l r : list X), j = i + length l -> (i, l ++ a ++ r) <sc Q -> (j, a) <sc Q
subcode_snoc_inv : forall (X : Type) (Q : code X) (i j : nat) (a l : list X), j = i + length l -> (i, l ++ a) <sc Q -> (j, a) <sc Q
list_pick : forall (X : Type) (ll : list X) (k : nat), k < length ll -> {x : X & {l : list X & {r : list X | ll = l ++ x :: r /\ length l = k}}}
list_split_length : forall (X : Type) (ll : list X) (k : nat), k <= length ll -> {l : list X & {r : list X | ll = l ++ r /\ length l = k}}
NoDup_nth : forall (A : Type) (l : list A) (d : A), NoDup l < -> (forall i j : nat, i < length l -> j < length l -> nth i l d = nth j l d -> i = j)
NoDup_nth_error : forall (A : Type) (l : list A), NoDup l < -> (forall i j : nat, i < length l -> nth_error l i = nth_error l j -> i = j)
list_app_cons_eq_inv : forall (X : Type) (l1 l2 r1 r2 : list X) (x : X), l1 ++ r1 = l2 ++ x :: r2 -> {m : list X | l1 ++ m = l2 /\ r1 = m ++ x :: r2} + {m : list X | l2 ++ x :: m = l1 /\ r2 = m ++ r1}
subcode_right : forall (X : Type) (n m : nat) (l r : list X), n = m + length l -> (n, r) <sc (m, l ++ r)
list_assoc_app : forall (X Y : Type) (eq_X_dec : eqdec X) (x : X) (ll mm : list (X * Y)), list_assoc eq_X_dec x (ll ++ mm) = match list_assoc eq_X_dec x ll with | Some y => Some y | None => list_assoc eq_X_dec x mm end
list_an_app_inv : forall (a n : nat) (l r : list nat), list_an a n = l ++ r -> l = list_an a (length l) /\ r = list_an (a + length l) (length r)
existsb_nth : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (l : list A) (n : nat) (d : A), n < length l -> existsb f l = false -> f (nth n l d) = false
length_compiler = fix length_compiler (lx : list X) : nat := match lx with | nil => 0 | x :: lx0 => lc x + length_compiler lx0 end : list X -> nat Arguments length_compiler _%list_scope
partition_length : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (l l1 l2 : list A), partition f l = (l1, l2) -> length l = length l1 + length l2
firstn_app_2 : forall (A : Type) (n : nat) (l1 l2 : list A), firstn (length l1 + n) (l1 ++ l2) = l1 ++ firstn n l2
Permutation.Permutation_nth : forall (A : Type) (l l' : list A) (d : A), l ~p l' < -> (let n := length l in length l' = n /\ (exists f : nat -> nat, FinFun.bFun n f /\ FinFun.bInjective n f /\ (forall x : nat, x < n -> nth x l' d = nth (f x) l d)))
nth_error_In : forall (A : Type) (l : list A) (n : nat) (x : A), nth_error l n = Some x -> In x l
subcode_app_invert_right : forall (X : Type) (j : nat) (Q1 Q2 : list X) (i : nat) (I : X), (i, I :: nil) <sc (j, Q1 ++ Q2) -> (i, I :: nil) <sc (j, Q1) \/ (i, I :: nil) <sc (length Q1 + j, Q2)
list_app_inj : forall (X : Type) (l1 l2 r1 r2 : list X), length l1 = length l2 -> l1 ++ r1 = l2 ++ r2 -> l1 = l2 /\ r1 = r2
Forall_nth : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), Forall P l < -> (forall (i : nat) (d : A), i < length l -> P (nth i l d))
list_assoc : forall X Y : Type, eqdec X -> X -> list (X * Y) -> option Y
nth_error_split : forall (A : Type) (l : list A) (n : nat) (a : A), nth_error l n = Some a -> exists l1 l2 : list A, l = l1 ++ a :: l2 /\ length l1 = n
list_an = fix list_an (a n : nat) {struct n} : list nat := match n with | 0 => nil | S n0 => a :: list_an (S a) n0 end : nat -> nat -> list nat Arguments list_an (_ _)%nat_scope
nth_split : forall (A : Type) (n : nat) (l : list A) (d : A), n < length l -> exists l1 l2 : list A, l = l1 ++ nth n l d :: l2 /\ length l1 = n
nth_nth_nth_map : forall (A : Type) (l : list A) (n : nat) (d : A) (ln : list nat) (dn : nat), n < length ln \/ length l <= dn -> nth (nth n ln dn) l d = nth n (map (fun x : nat => nth x l d) ln) d
eqdec = fun X : Type => forall x y : X, {x = y} + {x <> y} : Type -> Type Arguments eqdec _%type_scope

- simpl. reflexivity.
- simpl. f_equal. apply IH.
